name: Gemma Claire
tweet: The Financial Crisis taught us property prices can go down as well as up. If you owe 95% of the value of your home to the bank & its value falls by more than 5%, then you owe more money than the house is worth. This is how people get trapped & unable to downsize #NegativeEquity

name: Gemma Claire
tweet: The reduction in stamp duty aimed to help more people afford a home. But people are savvy & those selling their homes to people benefiting from this ‚Äúdiscount‚Äù just increased the price.. name: Gemma Claire

name: Gemma Claire
tweet: What the recession means & what‚Äôs next..? üëá

name: Gemma Claire
tweet: We also haven‚Äôt seen the end of the furlough scheme, meaning there could be another spike in unemployment later in the year..  Plus interest rates are now at near 0, meaning less room for further cuts to help bolster things..   So it‚Äôll take time to recover  #UKRecession

name: Gemma Claire
tweet: We tend to fear the unknown - if we‚Äôre worried about how we‚Äôll be able to look after our families, we tend to hunker down and avoid spending money.. Businesses sell less goods and have to cut jobs.. That creates more fear‚Ä¶ And that cycle repeats.. #UKRecession

name: Gemma Claire
tweet: #UKRecession means our economy has shrunk (we‚Äôve produced less) over the last 6 months. Industries have fared differently - some online retailers saw sales soar, while hospitality struggles. Social distancing means restaurants rent the same space but with fewer customers..
